p: As can be seen, betulin 1 and betulin phosphate 2 did not demonstrate the ability to inhibit HIV replication in the tested range of concentrations. Betulin derivatives containing a 3′,3′-dimethylglutaric group that exhibit significant activity against HIV-1 are described in the literature [ 34, 35]. Corresponding phosphorus derivative 4 demonstrated good activity and selectivity that were higher than obtained for 4′,4′-dimethylglutaric derivative 5. On the other hand, compound 4 was more active than the previously described 3′,3′-dimethylglutaric derivatives of betulinic acid, which in the C30 position contained a diethylphosphate or diethylphosphonate group (IC 50 = 0.6 μM and 0.9 μM, respectively) [ 12].
